data.title: Halldór Laxness – Documentary
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1955 was awarded to Halldór Kiljan Laxness "for his vivid epic power which has renewed the great narrative art of Iceland"
data.text:
Halldór Laxness

Documentary

Your browser does not support the video tag.

Nobel Prize Laureate in Literature 1955, Halldór Laxness, at his home in Gljúfrasteinn, Island. Mr. Laxness talks to the head of Reykjavik National Theatre, Mr. Rosencrantz, outside the theatre. The video also shows Halldór Laxness in Stockholm for the opening of the film Salka Valka, based on one of his books.

To cite this section
